intro: Aglaonema cambodianum, commonly known as the Cambodian evergreen. It is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia, characterized by its striking, variegated foliage with shades of green, white, and pink. The leaves are typically broad and lance-shaped, arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. It thrives in low-light conditions and requires moderate humidity and well-draining soil. This plant is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and air-purifying properties.
